item.title: Covid: Zero daily deaths announced in UK for first time
item.description: The latest figures come amid concern over a recent small rise in cases linked to the Indian variant.

item.title: Covid: Scotland 'at the start' of a third wave
item.description: Scotland's national clinical director says more cases are inevitable as society gradually opens up again.

item.title: Tulsa Race Massacre: President Biden commemorates 100-year anniversary
item.description: The 1921 massacre in Oklahoma remains one of the worst incidents of racial violence in US history.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer: Five things we learned from Piers Morgan interview
item.description: We look at what the Labour leader revealed in his interview on ITV's Piers Morgan's Life Stories.

item.title: Euro 2020: Trent Alexander-Arnold named in England's 26-man squad
item.description: Liverpool full-back Trent Alexander-Arnold has been named in England's 26-man squad for this summer's European Championship.

item.title: Blackpool Pleasure Beach: Grand National rollercoaster riders rescued
item.description: Riders are escorted back down the track after Blackpool Pleasure Beach's Grand National breaks down.

item.title: New China three-child policy sparks tales of 'trauma'
item.description: Some online are calling for compensation for people who wanted more children in the past.

item.title: Alaska: Biden to suspend Trump Arctic drilling leases
item.description: The president will suspend oil and gas leases in Alaska's Arctic National Wildlife Refuge.

item.title: Grand Slams pledge better support for players
item.description: The Grand Slam events say they want to "create meaningful improvements" in supporting players after Naomi Osaka's withdrawal from the French Open.

item.title: Anthony Sootheran murder: Woman who starved millionaire to death jailed
item.description: Lynda Rickard is jailed for 28 years for killing Anthony Sootheran to steal from his £3.5m estate.

item.title: Sarah Everard died from compression of the neck
item.description: The 33-year-old vanished as she walked home from a friend's house in Clapham in March.

item.title: House hit by car for third time 'at risk of collapse'
item.description: In the latest incident, a car crashed through the lounge, leaving the house unstable, its owner said.

item.title: Boris Johnson and wife Carrie take two-day mini honeymoon
item.description: No 10 would not reveal where the prime minister and his wife went, but said he is now back at work.

item.title: Sky Pool: World's first 'floating' pool between tower blocks
item.description: As temperatures reached 24°C (76.5F), some London residents bathed while suspended 35m (115ft) in the air.

item.title: Covid-19: 'I was on the brink of death'
item.description: Sharron Mullinger contracted Covid-19 during the second wave and was taken to an intensive care unit.

item.title: Mars: Nasa's Perseverance rover's first 100 days in pictures
item.description: Stunning images as Nasa's Perseverance continues its mission to seek signs of past microbial life.

item.title: Kinmel Bay: Girl rescued after dinghy drifts out to sea
item.description: A young girl is rescued from a mile out at sea after the inflatable was detached from a safety line.

item.title: 'My children have now heard their grandmother's voice'
item.description: Ed Morrish heard his mother's voice for the first time in 15 years after finding an old voice message.

item.title: Belarus: A climate of fear for opposition activists
item.description: The BBC speaks to some of those whose lives have been changed forever by the protests in Belarus.

item.title: Yemen fishermen find $1.5m of ambergris in the belly of a whale
item.description: A lucky find in the belly of a whale has changed the lives of a group of poor Yemeni fishermen.

item.title: Cycling: Councils under pressure to change bike shed planning laws
item.description: There are calls to change planning rules to make it easier to have cycle sheds in front gardens.

item.title: Covid: Horse therapy for NHS nurse is 'magical'
item.description: Intensive care sister Amanda White, who lost her nephew to the virus, says the therapy "reset" her.

item.title: The Papers: 'Third wave alert' and jab donations call
item.description: The front pages focus on concerns over rising Covid cases and calls for poorer nations to be given more jabs.

item.title: Sinéad O'Connor: My life is actually really boring
item.description: "I've got to the time in life where you just want to sit and be peaceful in your garden and knit."

item.title: Lockdown album written by Bungay singer, 16, after cancer diagnosis
item.description: Pearll, who is now in remission, says she saw the spare time as an "opportunity" to record songs.

item.title: Severn Estuary lave net fisheries 'destroyed' by new rules
item.description: Lave net fishermen have caught Severn Estuary salmon for 400 years but fear new rules will kill them.

item.title: How significant is a day without Covid deaths?
item.description: There have been no coronavirus deaths announced today - is this a moment for celebration?

item.title: The city dwellers who want a more tribal way of living
item.description: A group of Edinburgh residents want to buy a 19th Century mansion to create their own community.

item.title: What is the fallout from Osaka's withdrawal?
item.description: As Roland Garros loses one of the sport's biggest stars, the issues raised by Osaka's withdrawal sit firmly in the spotlight.

item.title: What students really want from school catch-up
item.description: Longer days? More tutors? Or stopping all the uncertainty? Pupils say what school recovery should mean.

item.title: Deaths plunge after town's adults vaccinated
item.description: An experiment in Brazil suggests the pandemic can be controlled after 75% of people are fully dosed.

item.title: Why electric cars will take over sooner than you think
item.description: The BBC's Justin Rowlatt explains why we are accelerating towards an electric car future.

item.title: Corrie actor Colson Smith: 'I've been trolled over my weight for 10 years'
item.description: Corrie actor Colson Smith's new show about his love of running is called Bored of Being the Fat Kid.

item.title: Alfred Fagon: Why his 70s play about black British life still resonates today
item.description: Alfred Fagon's pioneering The Death of a Black Man still holds true as it receives a revival.

item.title: Then and now: Pandemic clears the air
item.description: Air pollution is highly damaging to the environment, but Covid lockdowns show we can clear the air.

item.title: The dancer aged 106 who bans the word 'old'
item.description: Meet Sydney artist Eileen Kramer, who has had some of her most productive years since turning 100.

item.title: The story of Spain’s ‘terrifying confidence’ – and how it conquered the world
item.description: One night of embarrassment in October 2006 convinced Spain that something had to change - sparking a momentum shift in world football.

item.title: Iran's presidential election: Four ways it matters
item.description: As Iranians prepare to go to the polls this month, here is why the vote will be closely watched.

item.title: Viewpoint: Why Germany's Namibia genocide apology is not enough
item.description: Germany is sorry for the massacres but the lack of reparations has angered targeted communities.

item.title: China-India clashes: No change a year after Ladakh stand-off
item.description: Nomads along the India-China border in the Galwan Valley are still living under the shadow of war.

item.title: Ancelotti leaves Everton for 'unexpected opportunity' at Real Madrid
item.description: Carlo Ancelotti leaves Everton to become head coach of Real Madrid for a second time.

item.title: Root wants England to put on a show against Kiwis as fans return at Lord's
item.description: Captain Joe Root wants England to put on a show for the Lord's fans during the first Test against New Zealand.

item.title: Not reaching semis at Euro 2020 will be a failure - England boss Southgate
item.description: Gareth Southgate says he has to "deliver" as England manager and anything less than reaching the semi-finals of the European Championship would be classed as a failure.

item.title: French Open 2021: Rafael Nadal & Novak Djokovic win, Andrey Rublev out at Roland Garros
item.description: Rafael Nadal begins his bid for a record-extending 14th French Open title with a win, while top seed Novak Djokovic is also through in straight sets.

item.title: Euro 2020: Scotland's dramatic Euro 2020 play-off qualifying match against Serbia, in which goalkeeper David Marshall became the hero
item.description: Ahead of Euro 2020, BBC Sport looks back at Scotland's dramatic route to the tournament, when they met Serbia in the qualifying play-offs.

item.title: French Open 2021: Serena Williams says she wants to hug Naomi Osaka after withdrawal
item.description: Three-time French Open champion Serena Williams says she wants to give Naomi Osaka a hug after the world number two withdrew from the tournament on refusing to speak to the media.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are now possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now reaching younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Scotland's Covid-19 rules are changing at the weekend - with much of the country seeing an easing of restrictions.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Covid vaccine update: Those that work - and the others on the way
item.description: Covid vaccination campaigns are under way in the UK and across the world.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk of Covid on public transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions are relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: Travel guide to Spain, Portugal, France and more holiday hotspots
item.description: What you need to know about travelling abroad to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: How are eviction rules for renters and landlords changing?
item.description: The eviction ban is ending, but what does that mean?

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and will they go ahead despite Covid?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics are due to start in July, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: The children selling explicit videos on OnlyFans
item.description: British subscription site OnlyFans is failing to prevent underage users from selling and appearing in explicit videos, a BBC investigation has found.

item.title: How Ben Crump became America's go-to police brutality lawyer
item.description: When families lose a loved one in a police shooting, more often than not Ben Crump gets a call. Why is he the go-to man?

item.title: Samantha Azzopardi: Australia's notorious con artist sentenced for child theft
item.description: Authorities are baffled by the "bizarre crime" of a serial con artist who has travelled the world.

item.title: After a 32-year battle for justice, what is Hillsborough's legacy?
item.description: As the collapse of the last criminal trial marks the end of a long legal road, Judith Moritz asks what the legacy of Britain’s worst sports disaster is.

item.title: Piccadilly 1965: How six Indian friends found their feet in the UK
item.description: One day in 1965 Praful Patel heard five men talking Gujarati in London's Central YMCA - they quickly became close friends.
